content:
Sintra is a beautiful town located about 30 minutes by train from Lisbon, and it is known for its enchanting palaces, castles, and gardens. Here are a few recommendations for what to see there:

1. Pena Palace - Pena Palace is one of the most popular attractions in Sintra and is known for its colorful architecture and beautiful gardens. It is located on top of a hill overlooking the town and offers stunning views of the surrounding area.

2. Castle of the Moors - This medieval castle dates back to the 8th century and was used to defend the town and the surrounding area. It is now a popular tourist attraction and offers beautiful views of Sintra and the surrounding countryside.

3. Quinta da Regaleira - This beautiful estate features a palace, chapel, gardens, and underground tunnels. It is known for its beautiful architecture and mystical symbolism and is a must-see for any visitor to Sintra.

4. Monserrate Palace - Monserrate Palace is a beautiful estate located on the outskirts of Sintra, known for its eclectic architecture and beautiful gardens. It also offers stunning views of the surrounding hills and countryside.

5. Sintra National Palace - This historic palace is located in the center of town and was used by the Portuguese royal family from the 15th to the 19th centuries. It is known for its beautiful architecture and beautiful collections of art and furniture.

These are just a few of the many beautiful attractions that Sintra has to offer, but they are definitely worth considering during your visit!
